result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael R Mecikalski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: COSTS PAID IN FULL FROM BOND
No use or possession of controlled substances, unless prescribed by a physician.   No possession of drug paraphernalia.  No contact with victim--Chad Webb.

Complete compas assessment,  counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate and followup.  Defendant shall comply with Mental Health Assessment.  Pay supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Defendant shall Maintain Absolute Sobriety.  Submit DNA sample if not previously submitted.  Defendant shall Submit to Random Urinalysis.  Defendant shall surrender all firearms and ammunition.  Defendant shall take all prescribed medications.

timeConds.notes: consecutive with good time and credit for 17 days time served.  Huber granted, if in compliance with jail facility regulations.  Defendant shall report to the Work Release Unit (M-F/7:30 am to 3:30 pm), within 72 hours of sentence date with a copy of the minute sheet and the completed GPS application to establish report date for serving sentence.  Report date shall be within 60 days of sentence date.  Huber shall be revoked for failure to report and a warrant shall be authorized.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or Substance Abuse Program.  Sentence shall run consecutive to any other imposed sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: No use or possession of controlled substances, unless prescribed by a physician.   No possession of drug paraphernalia.  No intoxicants.  No possession of any weapons or ammunition.  No contact with Mr. Webb or Mr. Gotschika.  No contact with daughters boyfriend unless approved by agent.

Complete compas assessment,  counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate and followup.  Pay supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections and follow rules of supervision.  Mental Health and Anger Management counseling as deemed appropriate.    Submit DNA sample if not previously provided.  Defendant shall Maintain Absolute Sobriety.  Defendant shall Submit to Random Urinalysis.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
